alert.note: Alert for Central Ventura County Valleys (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued January 07 at 1:47PM PST until January 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 AM PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 32 will result in frost formation. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 30 possible. * WHERE...Central Ventura County Valleys. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 7 PM PST this evening. For the Frost Advisory, from 1 AM to 10 AM PST Monday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Monday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.
